Recently, M gB2 was found to be m etallic superconductorwith transition tem perature (Tc) of about 40 K . [1,2], and has provided great scienti c interest. [7] The possible origin of the enhanced To is suggested to originate from a strong election-phonon interaction and a enhanced phonon frequency due to the light boron m ass in M gB2 . abstracts.abstract: The longitudinal resistivity (ρ<SUB>xx</SUB>) and Hall coefficient (R<SUB>H</SUB>) were measured for MgB<SUB>2</SUB> sintered under high pressure. We found that R<SUB>H</SUB> is positive like cuprate high-T<SUB>c</SUB> superconductors, and decreases as the temperature increases for 40 K <T<300 K. The cotangent of the Hall angle was found to follow a+bT<SUP>2</SUP> behavior from T<SUB>c</SUB> to 300 K. At T=100 K, R<SUB>H</SUB>=4.1×10<SUP>-11</SUP> m<SUP>3</SUP>/C from which the hole carrier density was determined to be 1.5×10<SUP>23</SUP>/cm<SUP>3</SUP>. This carrier density is 1-2 orders of magnitude larger than those of Nb<SUB>3</SUB>Sn and optimally doped YBa<SUB>2</SUB>Cu<SUB>3</SUB>O<SUB>y</SUB> superconductors.
